Posts.Content: thedarkknight wrote: hi, i'm new to this forum and i'm terrified. it took me years to even get to this stage and seek for help. i'm a girl, almost 20 years of age and discovered a lump on my left breast a few years ago. being young and scared it was an easily avoidable thought and i completely ignored it and continued on with life.  recently however, it seems to be a recurring problem. i often feel sharp random pains and even slight pains on my right breast too. i'm a med student and seemed to be constantly hearing about this topic, so upon further research and BSE, i found that its an hard lump, about 3 cm big in the areola, with no axillary lymph node invasion. after reading this site today im even more terrified that its stage IIA. there's no other signs present such as nipple discharge and only slight flattening of the nipple. i know it's time to get it checked out.. i have lived in denial for too long now. But i live with my parents at home and with my siblings.. I have no idea how to break this news to them. No idea how they'll handle it. No idea how much longer I can handle it.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: terrified.. how to talk about this with family members thedarkknight BikerLee
